description: For declaring properties in RML it is used the predicate rr:predicateObjectMap as shown in the mapping below. Notice that for the object property the rr:predicate must specify the predicate that will appear in the output triplets and, similarly how the subject is specifyed, the object property is declared using rr:template and a string contaning static information and may have data coming from the data source (the CSV in this case), for instance "http://dbpedia.org/resource/{City}". Fill the mapping below with the object property rdfs:seeAlso "http://dbpedia.org/resource/{City}"
expected_result:
<http://sample.com/resource/P1> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person>;
  <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#seeAlso> <http://dbpedia.org/resource/Oneonta>;
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Lily Dickens";
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/phone> "585-610-2352" .
